page.title: 06Communication in Halesowen
page.content: Halesowen is served by a central post office situated in the centre of the town and twelve sub post offices around the town. The central post office deals with 100,000 letters per day, incoming and outgoing, receiving mail from and passing mail on to the larger sorting office at Birmingham for distribution to various parts of the country. First class mail usually reaches its destination within one day of posting while second class mail takes three days. Halesowen is also part of the British Telecom network with facilities for making local, national, and international calls either from private telephones in the home or office, or from public telephone boxes for a small charge.
